revised_title: The Development of the Thymus, Epithelial Bodies, and Thyroid in Marsupials
tldr: This study examines the development of the thymus, epithelial bodies, and thyroid in marsupials, focusing on the species Trichosurus vulpecula. The research reveals that marsupials have a more primitive thymus development compared to other mammals, with two pairs of thoracic thymus glands derived from the entoderm of the third and fourth gill-pouches. The findings contribute to the understanding of the organogenesis and development of these endocrine structures in marsupials.
scientific_discipline: Biology and Life Sciences > Developmental Biology
